examples.text: the discordance between sales and evidence should be a focus

definitions: the quality of sounding harsh and jarring because of a lack of harmony

examples.text: fast songs can go through slow phases, and minor keys and discordance may be employed

shortDefinitions: quality of sounding harsh and jarring

definitions: the occurrence of a trait or disease in only one member of a matched pair of subjects, especially twins

examples.text: relatively high rates of discordance among identical twins clearly point to the importance of additional factors

shortDefinitions: occurrence of trait or disease in only one member of matched pair of subjects
